summary: This document is an email chain from May 28, 2020, between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel discussing scheduling a call regarding the Epstein probate case. It includes a forwarded update from February 2020 detailing legal developments, including the Virgin Islands Attorney General's actions against Epstein's estate, demands for a victim compensation program, and the freezing of estate assets.

persons.name: Denise George
persons.role: Attorney General of the U.S. Virgin Islands
persons.context: She brought charges against Epstein's estate, alleged his lawyers were part of his fraud, placed liens on his islands, and made demands for a victim compensation program.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.role: Lawyer and Executor of Epstein's estate
persons.context: Named as an executor in Epstein's will; the Virgin Islands AG alleged he may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Richard Kahn
persons.role: Lawyer and Executor of Epstein's estate
persons.context: Named as an executor in Epstein's will; the Virgin Islands AG alleged he may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

persons.name: Bennet Moskowitz
persons.context: Claimed that liens against the estate have left him unable to release money from Epstein's fortune to a victim's compensation fund.

persons.name: Ken Feinberg
persons.context: Reported to be the proposed overseer of a voluntary resolution program for Epstein's accusers, having previously overseen claims for 9/11, Catholic church sex abuse, and the BP oil spill.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Deceased financier and accused sex trafficker
persons.context: The subject of the probate case; his estate is involved in litigation over victim compensation and asset management following his death.

persons.name: Edward Helmore
persons.context: Author of the news article about the dispute between Epstein's lawyers and the Virgin Islands AG.

connections.description: Both named as executors of Jeffrey Epstein's will and are jointly handling the estate.

events.title: Virgin Islands AG files charges against Epstein estate
events.description: Virgin Islands Attorney General Denise George brought charges against Epstein's estate and alleged his lawyers, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud. She also placed claims on Epstein's two islands.

events.title: Guardian publishes article on probate dispute
events.description: The Guardian published an article by Edward Helmore detailing the dispute between Epstein's estate lawyers and the Virgin Islands Attorney General over the victim compensation fund and asset liens.

events.title: Probate update email circulated
events.description: A detailed email update on the Epstein probate case was circulated within the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, summarizing recent court filings and the Virgin Islands AG's demands.

events.title: Scheduling of Epstein probate call
events.description: US Attorney's Office personnel exchanged emails to schedule a Webex call to discuss the Epstein probate case and plan litigation strategy with the estate.

events.title: Epstein's death by suicide
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein died by suicide in a Manhattan jail cell, triggering victim claims for compensation and wide-ranging investigations.

locations: Epstein's two islands (in the Virgin Islands)
keyFacts: The Virgin Islands Attorney General, Denise George, has placed liens on Epstein's estate assets, freezing bank accounts and demanding prior approval for all expenditures by the executors.
George alleges that Epstein's lawyers and estate executors, Darren Indyke and Richard Kahn, may have been part of Epstein's alleged fraud.

Key demands from the Virgin Islands AG for a victim compensation program include: the estate must cooperate with investigations, waive NDAs for former employees, not require third-party releases from victims, provide a complete asset inventory, and exclude executors from administering the fund.

Epstein's estate had proposed a victim compensation program to be overseen by Ken Feinberg, but the Virgin Islands AG and some victim lawyers oppose it, arguing it maintains secrecy and prevents new information from emerging.
The email chain shows ongoing coordination within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York regarding litigation strategy with Epstein's estate as of May 2020.
